original: Einerth, Eric Gustaf Einar, direktör, Mariestad, f. 15/3/90 i Renneslöv, Hall. 1., av Carl Petersson o. Anna Johansson. G. 19 m. Elisabeth White-field. Barn: Gunvor f. 19, g. m. lärov :adj. Tore Wilander, Karl-Erik 22, Kerstin 27, Bengt 35. — Kont:chef h. A-B Frick & Oldny i Malmö 19-24, kamrer v. System A-B i Halm’Stad 24-38, disp. v. System A-B i Falköp. 38, verkst. dir. v. System A-B i Mariestad, förest, f. Skarab. 1. kristidsstyr. kontr :byrå sed. 40. Styr :led. i Skarab. 1. nykterh :ndrs centr :org., led. av nykterh :nd i Mariestad. Ordf. i Mariestads landst :fören. ungd:avd., v. 16 ordf. i landst :fören., fd. landst :löjtn., medl’. av Frimurarorden, W-sex, NN, 7.B. Hobby: trädg:od’L Lands^tGM, CFBSM, ProPGM.
translated: Einerth, Eric Gustaf Einar, director, Mariestad, born March 15, 1890 in Renneslöv, Halland, first district, son of Carl Petersson and Anna Johansson. Married in 1919 to Elisabeth Whitefield. Children: Gunvor (born 1919, married to school teacher Tore Wilander), Karl-Erik (born 1922), Kerstin (born 1927), Bengt (born 1935). Worked as a managing director for A-B Frick & Oldny in Malmö from 1919 to 1924, as an accountant for System A-B in Halmstad from 1924 to 1938, as a manager for System A-B in Falköping in 1938, and as an executive director for System A-B in Mariestad. Was also in charge of the Skaraborg 1st district's wartime contract bureau since 1940. Was a member of the board of the Skaraborg 1st district's temperance organization and a member of the temperance movement in Mariestad. Served as chairman of the youth section of the Mariestad County Association, was chairman of the county association, a former county lieutenant, a member of the Freemasons, the W-six, the NN, and the 7.B. Hobby: gardening. Awards: Lands^tGM, CFBSM, ProPGM.
